item.title: Alicia add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Evil is always possible. And goodness is eternally difficult." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Patricia A. McKillip
item.description: "Imagination is the golden-eyed monster that never sleeps. It must be fed; it cannot be ignored." -- Patricia A. McKillip

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "The only real stumbling block is fear of failure. In cooking you've got to have a what-the-hell attitude." -- Julia Child

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "Noble deeds and hot baths are the best cures for depression." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Christopher Morley
item.description: "There is no mistaking a real book when one meets it. It is like falling in love." -- Christopher Morley

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Frank McCourt
item.description: "You might be poor, your shoes might be broken, but your mind is a palace." -- Frank McCourt

item.title: Alicia add a quote by George Santayana
item.description: "Sanity is a madness put to good uses." -- George Santayana

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Abigail Adams
item.description: "If particular care and attention is not paid to the ladies, we are determined to foment a rebellion, and will not hold ourselves bound by any laws in which we have no voice or representation." -- Abigail Adams

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Jane Addams
item.description: "The good we secure for ourselves is precarious and uncertain until it is secured for all of us and incorporated into our common life." -- Jane Addams

item.title: Alicia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Eating and reading are two pleasures that combine admirably." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Paul Auster
item.description: "Reading was my escape and my comfort, my consolation, my stimulant of choice: reading for the pure pleasure of it, for the beautiful stillness that surrounds you when you hear an author's words reverberating in your head." -- Paul Auster

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Kate Chopin
item.description: "The voice of the sea speaks to the soul." -- Kate Chopin

item.title: Alicia add a quote by Clare Boothe Luce
item.description: "Money can't buy happiness, but it can make you awfully comfortable while you're being miserable." -- Clare Boothe Luce
